whatsapp.alertMessage: It looks like WhatsApp is not installed or accessible on your device.

start.text: What kind of dizziness are you feeling?

spinning_duration.text: How long do your spinning attacks usually last?

spinning_trigger.text: Are they triggered by positional changes (e.g., lying down, turning)?

hearing_issues.text: Do you experience ear fullness, ringing (tinnitus), or hearing loss?

upper_respiratory.text: Have you had any recent cold, sinus infection, or upper respiratory infection?

head_trauma.text: Any history of head trauma or injury recently?

nausea_vomiting.text: Do you also experience persistent nausea or vomiting?

cardio_palpitations.text: Do you feel chest tightness, palpitations, or shortness of breath during blackouts?

neuro_syncopal.text: Any slurred speech, confusion, or limb weakness during these events?

lightheaded_trigger.text: When do you feel lightheaded or unsteady?

options.random: Randomly, including when sitting or lying
options.infection: With fever, chills, or recent infection

endocrine_symptoms.text: Do you experience unexplained fatigue, weight gain/loss, or excessive sweating?

psychiatric_stress.text: Do you feel detached from reality (derealization)?

psychiatric_anxiety.text: Do these symptoms coincide with panic attacks or anxiety?

systemic_infection.text: Have you experienced recent viral infection, unexplained fever, or fatigue?

vision_issues.text: Do you experience blurred vision, double vision, difficulty focusing, or eye strain?

vision_additional.text: Are these symptoms associated with headaches, dizziness, or nausea?

neuro_or_ophthalmology.text: Are these visual symptoms associated with limb weakness or slurred speech?

neck_pain_relation.text: Is your dizziness related to neck pain or limited range of motion?

neck_additional.text: Do you have headaches, tingling, or numbness in your arms or hands?

general.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor urgently due to red flag symptoms.

spinning.title: Spinning
spinning.desc: A feeling that the room or you are moving or rotating.

blackout.title: Blackout / Fainting
blackout.desc: A feeling of near-fainting or complete loss of consciousness.

lightheaded.title: Lightheaded
lightheaded.desc: A floating, woozy sensation ‚Äî not quite spinning, but disorienting.

unsteady.title: Unsteady
unsteady.desc: A feeling of imbalance or swaying while walking or standing.

neck.title: Neck / Posture related
neck.desc: Feeling dizzy when moving or holding your neck in certain positions.

specialties.general: ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor urgently due to red flag symptoms.

ent.label: Ear - related vertigo
ent.description: Symptoms suggest an inner ear or balance system issue, commonly causing positional vertigo.
ent.nextSteps: Rest in a dark, quiet room. Avoid sudden movements.
ent.contact: Visit a local ENT clinic or hospital.

cardio.label: Heart-related dizziness
cardio.description: Pattern suggests a cardiovascular cause such as blood pressure changes or arrhythmia.
redFlags: Tightness in chest or shortness of breath
cardio.nextSteps: Stay hydrated and avoid exertion until seen by a doctor.
cardio.contact: Visit a cardiology department at your nearest hospital.

neuro.label: Neurological-related dizziness
neuro.description: Possible link to migraines, balance centers, or transient ischemic events.
neuro.nextSteps: Avoid stress and take notes of symptoms for medical consultation.
neuro.contact: See a neurologist for brain and nervous system evaluation.

psychiatry.label: Psychiatry-related dizziness
psychiatry.description: Symptoms may stem from anxiety, panic disorder, or somatoform disorders.
psychiatry.nextSteps: Practice relaxation techniques and consult mental health professionals.
psychiatry.contact: Visit a mental health clinic or psychiatrist.

orthopedics.label: Orthopedic-related dizziness
orthopedics.description: Symptoms related to neck pain or cervical spine disorders.
orthopedics.nextSteps: Avoid neck strain and seek orthopedic assessment.
orthopedics.contact: Visit an orthopedic clinic for spinal evaluation.

endocrinology.label: Endocrine-related dizziness
endocrinology.description: Could be linked to blood sugar fluctuations, thyroid dysfunction, or hormonal imbalance.
endocrinology.nextSteps: Monitor symptoms and consult endocrinologist for testing.
endocrinology.contact: See an endocrinologist for hormone evaluation.

ophthalmology.label: Eye-related dizziness
ophthalmology.description: Visual disturbances causing dizziness, due to eye muscle or optic nerve dysfunction.
ophthalmology.nextSteps: Avoid visual strain and consult eye specialist.

infectious.label: Infectious-related Dizziness
infectious.description: Possible systemic causes like infection, anemia, or dehydration.
infectious.nextSteps: Stay hydrated and consult doctor urgently.
infectious.contact: Visit your nearest hospital for internal medicine consult.

general.label: Unspecified or Red Flag Dizziness
general.description: Red flag symptoms require urgent comprehensive medical assessment.
redFlags: Sudden, severe headache (worst headache of your life)
Acute vision loss, blurred or double vision
Limb weakness, numbness, or facial drooping
Difficulty speaking, slurred speech, or confusion
Loss of consciousness or unexplained fainting
Severe chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath
Unexplained fever, chills, or signs of infection
Unsteady gait, falls, or inability to walk safely
New-onset severe dizziness after head trauma
Severe fatigue or unexplained weight loss
Signs of low blood sugar (sweating, shaking, confusion)
general.contact: See a general physician for a full workup.

unknown.label: Result Not Recognized
unknown.description: We couldn't determine a specific outcome. Please retry.

about.paragraph1: DizzySense is a free offline-first app that helps users understand possible causes of dizziness and provides guidance on which medical specialist to consult.
about.paragraph2: No personal data is collected. All processing happens on your device.
about.clickHint: (Click on the above links to read more)

home.subtitle1: Unsure whether it's Vertigo, Dizziness, Giddiness, or a Blackout?
home.subtitle2: walks you through a short quiz to help you:
home.bullet2: üëâ Learn common causes and warning signs.
home.bullet3: üëâ Get clear guidance on which specialist to consult.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: üåÄ DizzySense ("the App", "we", "our") is a mobile application designed to help users understand possible causes of dizziness and guide them toward appropriate medical specialists. We value your privacy and do not collect any personally identifiable information.
privacy.infoCollectText:
We do not collect, store, or transmit any of the following:

‚Ä¢ Your name, email address, phone number, or personal identity
‚Ä¢ Location or device identifiers
‚Ä¢ Health records or medical history

The app runs entirely on your device and does not transmit any quiz responses or data to our servers or any third parties.
privacy.permissionsText: DizzySense does not request access to your camera, contacts, location, or microphone. It only uses basic device functions necessary to run the app smoothly.
privacy.thirdPartyText1: We do not use any third-party analytics, advertising, or tracking tools (such as Google Analytics, Facebook SDK, etc.).
privacy.thirdPartyText2: The app may open external websites (e.g. Google Search) for convenience. These are handled by your device's browser, and DizzySense does not transmit any personal information.
privacy.disclaimerText: DizzySense is not a substitute for professional medical advice or diagnosis. It is intended for informational purposes only. Always consult a qualified healthcare provider regarding any symptoms or health concerns.
privacy.securityText: Since the app does not collect data, there is no personal data to secure or transmit. All symptom selections and quiz logic occur entirely on your device.
privacy.childrenText: DizzySense is not directed at children under 13. We do not knowingly collect data from anyone, including minors.
privacy.contactText:
If you have any questions about this privacy policy or the app:
Email: entclinicdwarka@gmail.com
Developer: Dr. Rahul Kapahi, ENT Consultant
Location: India
privacy.summaryText: Your privacy is important to us. DizzySense was built with the goal of providing safe, offline-first medical guidance without any tracking, advertising, or data collection.
privacy.homeButtonLabel: Go back to the home screen

specialist.title: Specialist Guide
specialist.errorSearch: Something went wrong while opening the search.

terms.title: üìÑ Terms & Conditions
terms.intro: By using üåÄDizzySense ("the App", "we", "our"), you agree to the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully before using the app.

useOfApp.heading: 1. Use of the App
useOfApp.paragraph: DizzySense is intended to provide general information and guidance related to dizziness. It is not a substitute for professional medical evaluation, diagnosis, or treatment.

medicalDisclaimer.heading: 2. Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.paragraph: This app does not provide medical advice. Always consult a qualified healthcare provider if you experience symptoms or have health-related questions. Do not delay seeking professional care based on information from this app.

noDataCollection.heading: 3. No Data Collection
noDataCollection.paragraph1: The app does not collect or store any personal data. All symptom inputs and interactions stay on your device. We do not track, store, or share your data with anyone.
noDataCollection.paragraph2: The app may open external websites (e.g. Google Search) for convenience. These are handled by your device's browser, and DizzySense does not transmit any personal information.

intellectualProperty.heading: 4. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.paragraph: All content within the app, including text, layout, and visuals, is the intellectual property of Dr. Rahul Kapahi. You may not reproduce or redistribute any part of this app without permission.

limitation.heading: 5. Limitation of Liability
limitation.paragraph: We are not liable for any harm or damage that may arise from the use or misuse of the app, including reliance on the guidance provided. Use of the app is at your own risk.

changes.heading: 6. Changes to Terms
changes.paragraph: We may update these terms occasionally. The latest version will always be available within the app. Continued use of the app implies your acceptance of any changes.

contact.heading: 7. Contact
contact.paragraph: For questions or concerns about these terms:
